FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: host dry mass
FIELD.NAME: host dry mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of dry mass

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: plant product
FIELD.NAME: plant product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: host wet mass
FIELD.NAME: host wet mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of wet mass

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host common name
FIELD.NAME: host common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the host, e.g. human

FIELD.LABEL: host taxid
FIELD.NAME: host taxid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

FIELD.LABEL: host life stage
FIELD.NAME: host life stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: description of life stage of host

FIELD.LABEL: mechanical damage
FIELD.NAME: mechanical damage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host length
FIELD.NAME: host length
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the length of subject

FIELD.LABEL: plant body site
FIELD.NAME: plant body site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host infra-specific name
FIELD.NAME: host infra-specific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level

FIELD.LABEL: host infra-specific rank
FIELD.NAME: host infra-specific rank
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
FIELD.NAME: host phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: climate environment
FIELD.NAME: climate environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

FIELD.LABEL: gaseous environment
FIELD.NAME: gaseous environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

FIELD.LABEL: seasonal environment
FIELD.NAME: seasonal environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: sample salinity
FIELD.NAME: sample salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.NAME: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: host genotype
FIELD.NAME: host genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: observed genotype

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: air temperature regimen
FIELD.NAME: air temperature regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

FIELD.LABEL: antibiotic regimen
FIELD.NAME: antibiotic regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

FIELD.LABEL: chemical mutagen
FIELD.NAME: chemical mutagen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

FIELD.LABEL: fertilizer regimen
FIELD.NAME: fertilizer regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

FIELD.LABEL: fungicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: fungicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: gravity
FIELD.NAME: gravity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

FIELD.LABEL: growth hormone regimen
FIELD.NAME: growth hormone regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

FIELD.LABEL: growth media
FIELD.NAME: growth media
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples

FIELD.LABEL: herbicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: herbicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: humidity regimen
FIELD.NAME: humidity regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.NAME: mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

FIELD.LABEL: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.NAME: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pesticide regimen
FIELD.NAME: pesticide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pH regimen
FIELD.NAME: pH regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

FIELD.LABEL: radiation regimen
FIELD.NAME: radiation regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

FIELD.LABEL: rainfall regimen
FIELD.NAME: rainfall regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: salt regimen
FIELD.NAME: salt regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

FIELD.LABEL: standing water regimen
FIELD.NAME: standing water regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: tissue culture growth media
FIELD.NAME: tissue culture growth media
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: description of plant tissue culture growth media used

FIELD.LABEL: watering regimen
FIELD.NAME: watering regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: water temperature regimen
FIELD.NAME: water temperature regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS soil
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS soil
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: geography

FIELD.LABEL: environmental package
FIELD.NAME: environmental package
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: environment (biome)
FIELD.NAME: environment (biome)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (feature)
FIELD.NAME: environment (feature)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (material)
FIELD.NAME: environment (material)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (altitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (altitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (elevation)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (elevation)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD.LABEL: slope gradient
FIELD.NAME: slope gradient
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: commonly called slope. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

FIELD.LABEL: slope aspect
FIELD.NAME: slope aspect
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

FIELD.LABEL: profile position
FIELD.NAME: profile position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: investigation type
FIELD.NAME: investigation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIxS compliant reports as standardised by Genomic Standards Consortium

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.43) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: finishing strategy
FIELD.NAME: finishing strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryote, bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD.LABEL: pooling of DNA extracts (if done)
FIELD.NAME: pooling of DNA extracts (if done)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: composite design/sieving (if any)
FIELD.NAME: composite design/sieving (if any)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

FIELD.LABEL: sample weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: weight (g) of soil processed

FIELD.LABEL: storage conditions (fresh/frozen/other)
FIELD.NAME: storage conditions (fresh/frozen/other)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

FIELD.LABEL: microbial biomass
FIELD.NAME: microbial biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 m. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

FIELD.LABEL: microbial biomass method
FIELD.NAME: microbial biomass method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: unusual properties

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/salinity
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measured salinity

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/salinity method
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/salinity method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining salinity

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: heavy metals present and concentrations of any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals method
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: aluminum saturation (esp. for tropical soils)

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation method
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: specific host
FIELD.NAME: specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

FIELD.LABEL: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v 2013-10-28) terms, for a browser please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: link

FIELD.LABEL: link to climate information
FIELD.NAME: link to climate information
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: link to climate resource

FIELD.LABEL: link to classification information
FIELD.NAME: link to classification information
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

FIELD.LABEL: links to additional analysis
FIELD.NAME: links to additional analysis
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: link to additional analysis results performed on the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: current land use
FIELD.NAME: current land use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: present state of sample site

FIELD.LABEL: current vegetation
FIELD.NAME: current vegetation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

FIELD.LABEL: current vegetation method
FIELD.NAME: current vegetation method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in vegetation classification

FIELD.LABEL: horizon
FIELD.NAME: horizon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

FIELD.LABEL: horizon method
FIELD.NAME: horizon method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the horizon

FIELD.LABEL: mean annual and seasonal temperature
FIELD.NAME: mean annual and seasonal temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: mean annual and seasonal temperature (C)

FIELD.LABEL: mean annual and seasonal precipitation
FIELD.NAME: mean annual and seasonal precipitation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: mean annual and seasonal precipitation (mm)

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification based on local soil classification system

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil type
FIELD.NAME: soil type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil series name or other lower-level classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil type method
FIELD.NAME: soil type method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

FIELD.LABEL: drainage classification
FIELD.NAME: drainage classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

FIELD.LABEL: texture
FIELD.NAME: texture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

FIELD.LABEL: texture method
FIELD.NAME: texture method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil texture

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD.LABEL: pH method
FIELD.NAME: pH method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining pH

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: water content method
FIELD.NAME: water content method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

FIELD.LABEL: total organic C method
FIELD.NAME: total organic C method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining total organic C

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen method
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: water content
FIELD.NAME: water content
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: water content measurement

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total nitrogen content of the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment history

FIELD.LABEL: history/previous land use
FIELD.NAME: history/previous land use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: previous land use and dates

FIELD.LABEL: history/previous land use method
FIELD.NAME: history/previous land use method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

FIELD.LABEL: history/crop rotation
FIELD.NAME: history/crop rotation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

FIELD.LABEL: history/agrochemical additions
FIELD.NAME: history/agrochemical additions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

FIELD.LABEL: history/tillage
FIELD.NAME: history/tillage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: note method(s) used for tilling

FIELD.LABEL: history/fire
FIELD.NAME: history/fire
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

FIELD.LABEL: history/flooding
FIELD.NAME: history/flooding
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

FIELD.LABEL: history/extreme events
FIELD.NAME: history/extreme events
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.NAME: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS wastewater sludge
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS wastewater sludge
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: geography

FIELD.LABEL: environmental package
FIELD.NAME: environmental package
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: environment (biome)
FIELD.NAME: environment (biome)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (feature)
FIELD.NAME: environment (feature)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (material)
FIELD.NAME: environment (material)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: investigation type
FIELD.NAME: investigation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIxS compliant reports as standardised by Genomic Standards Consortium

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.43) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: finishing strategy
FIELD.NAME: finishing strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryote, bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: bioreactor

FIELD.LABEL: biochemical oxygen demand
FIELD.NAME: biochemical oxygen demand
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

FIELD.LABEL: chemical oxygen demand
FIELD.NAME: chemical oxygen demand
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

FIELD.LABEL: pre-treatment
FIELD.NAME: pre-treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

FIELD.LABEL: primary treatment
FIELD.NAME: primary treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

FIELD.LABEL: reactor type
FIELD.NAME: reactor type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

FIELD.LABEL: secondary treatment
FIELD.NAME: secondary treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

FIELD.LABEL: sludge retention time
FIELD.NAME: sludge retention time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the time activated sludge remains in reactor

FIELD.LABEL: tertiary treatment
FIELD.NAME: tertiary treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: specific host
FIELD.NAME: specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

FIELD.LABEL: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v 2013-10-28) terms, for a browser please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: alkalinity
FIELD.NAME: alkalinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

FIELD.LABEL: industrial effluent percent
FIELD.NAME: industrial effluent percent
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

FIELD.LABEL: sewage type
FIELD.NAME: sewage type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of wastewater treatment plant as municipal or industrial

FIELD.LABEL: wastewater type
FIELD.NAME: wastewater type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: efficiency percent
FIELD.NAME: efficiency percent
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

FIELD.LABEL: emulsions
FIELD.NAME: emulsions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

FIELD.LABEL: gaseous substances
FIELD.NAME: gaseous substances
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

FIELD.LABEL: inorganic particles
FIELD.NAME: inorganic particles
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

FIELD.LABEL: organic particles
FIELD.NAME: organic particles
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

FIELD.LABEL: sample salinity
FIELD.NAME: sample salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

FIELD.LABEL: soluble inorganic material
FIELD.NAME: soluble inorganic material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

FIELD.LABEL: soluble organic material
FIELD.NAME: soluble organic material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

FIELD.LABEL: suspended solids
FIELD.NAME: suspended solids
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter, etc,; can include multiple substances

FIELD.LABEL: total phosphate
FIELD.NAME: total phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total amount or concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: nitrate
FIELD.NAME: nitrate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrate

FIELD.LABEL: phosphate
FIELD.NAME: phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: sodium
FIELD.NAME: sodium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sodium concentration

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total nitrogen content of the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.NAME: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits

All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
