FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: biomass
FIELD.NAME: biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

FIELD.LABEL: density
FIELD.NAME: density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: density of sample

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: specific host
FIELD.NAME: specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

FIELD.LABEL: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v 2013-10-28) terms, for a browser please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: alkalinity
FIELD.NAME: alkalinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

FIELD.LABEL: water current
FIELD.NAME: water current
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid

FIELD.LABEL: pressure
FIELD.NAME: pressure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: ammonium
FIELD.NAME: ammonium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of ammonium

FIELD.LABEL: bromide
FIELD.NAME: bromide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of bromide

FIELD.LABEL: calcium
FIELD.NAME: calcium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of calcium

FIELD.LABEL: chloride
FIELD.NAME: chloride
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chloride

FIELD.LABEL: chlorophyll
FIELD.NAME: chlorophyll
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chlorophyll

FIELD.LABEL: diether lipids
FIELD.NAME: diether lipids
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.NAME: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.NAME: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved oxygen

FIELD.LABEL: nitrate
FIELD.NAME: nitrate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrate

FIELD.LABEL: nitrite
FIELD.NAME: nitrite
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrite

FIELD.LABEL: nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrogen (total)

FIELD.LABEL: organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: organic matter
FIELD.NAME: organic matter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic matter

FIELD.LABEL: organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: phosphate
FIELD.NAME: phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.NAME: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

FIELD.LABEL: potassium
FIELD.NAME: potassium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of potassium

FIELD.LABEL: salinity
FIELD.NAME: salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: salinity measurement

FIELD.LABEL: silicate
FIELD.NAME: silicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of silicate

FIELD.LABEL: sodium
FIELD.NAME: sodium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sodium concentration

FIELD.LABEL: sulfate
FIELD.NAME: sulfate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfate

FIELD.LABEL: sulfide
FIELD.NAME: sulfide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfide

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.NAME: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA prokaryotic pathogen minimal sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA prokaryotic pathogen minimal sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information required for a prokaryotic pathogen sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collected_by
FIELD.NAME: collected_by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of the person who collected the specimen

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: host
FIELD.NAME: host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: host health state
FIELD.NAME: host health state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.

FIELD.LABEL: identified_by
FIELD.NAME: identified_by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of the taxonomist who identified the specimen

FIELD.LABEL: isolation_source
FIELD.NAME: isolation_source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

FIELD.LABEL: lat_lon
FIELD.NAME: lat_lon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected

FIELD.LABEL: lab_host
FIELD.NAME: lab_host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: scientific name of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: environmental_sample
FIELD.NAME: environmental_sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: identifies records derived by direct molecular isolation from a bulk environmental DNA sample (by PCR with or without subsequent cloning of the product, DGGE, or other anonymous methods) with no reliable identification of the source organism. Environmental samples include clinical samples, gut contents, and others from anonymous organisms that may be associated with a particular host. They do not include endosymbionts that can be reliably recovered from a particular host, organisms from a readily identifiable but uncultured field sample (e.g., many cyanobacteria), or phytoplasmas that can be reliably recovered from diseased plants (even though these cannot be grown in axenic culture).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the source organism

FIELD.LABEL: mating_type
FIELD.NAME: mating_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: mating type of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; mating type is used for prokaryotes, and for eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Pointer to physical material
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: References to sample or sample source material in physical resources

FIELD.LABEL: bio_material
FIELD.NAME: bio_material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: identifier for the biological material from which the sample was obtained, with optional institution code and collection code for the place where it is currently stored.

FIELD.LABEL: culture_collection
FIELD.NAME: culture_collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: institution code and identifier for the culture from which the sample was obtained, with optional collection code.

FIELD.LABEL: specimen_voucher
FIELD.NAME: specimen_voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: identifier for the specimen from which the sample was obtained

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: isolate
FIELD.NAME: isolate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: individual isolate from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of strain from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: sub_species
FIELD.NAME: sub_species
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of sub-species of organism from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: sub_strain
FIELD.NAME: sub_strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or identifier of a genetically or otherwise modified strain from which sample was obtained, derived from a parental strain (which should be annotated in the strain field; sub_strain from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: serovar
FIELD.NAME: serovar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: serological variety of a species (usually a prokaryote) characterized by its antigenic properties

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA Micro B3
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Micro B3
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information about a Micro B3 sample. A checklist for reporting metadata of marine microbial samples associated with genomics data. NOTE: Non-genomics data, i.e. oceanographic environmental data and morphology-based biodiversity data, should be submitted to the appropriate National Oceanographic Data Centre according to established reporting practices maintained by oceanographic community experts. Major National Oceanographic Data Centres from countries bordering the North-East Atlantic, and its adjacent seas: the Mediterranean, the Black Sea, the Baltic, the North Sea and the Arctic are listed at http://www.seadatanet.org/Overview/Partners. For the Ocean Sampling Day campaign, non-genomics data shall be reported to the PANGAEA (http://www.pangaea.de/submit/).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Event

FIELD.LABEL: Event Date/Time
FIELD.NAME: Event Date/Time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date and time in UTC when the sampling event started and ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct even. Format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ. Example: 2013-06-21T14:05:00Z/2013-06-21T14:46:00Z.

FIELD.LABEL: Latitude Start
FIELD.NAME: Latitude Start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Latitude of the location where the sampling event started, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ##.####, Decimal degrees; North= +, South= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -24.6666.

FIELD.LABEL: Longitude Start
FIELD.NAME: Longitude Start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Longitude of the location where the sampling event started, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ###.####, Decimal degrees; East= +, West= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -096.1012.

FIELD.LABEL: Latitude End
FIELD.NAME: Latitude End
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Latitude of the location where the sampling event ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ##.####, Decimal degrees; North= +, South= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -24.6643.

FIELD.LABEL: Longitude End
FIELD.NAME: Longitude End
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Longitude of the location where the sampling event ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ###.####, Decimal degrees; East= +, West= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -096.1171.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Sample

FIELD.LABEL: Depth
FIELD.NAME: Depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The distance below the surface of the water at which a measurement was made or a sample was collected. Format: ####.##, Positive below the sea surface. SDN:P06:46:ULAA for m. Example: 14.71

FIELD.LABEL: Protocol Label
FIELD.NAME: Protocol Label
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the protocol used to produce the sample, e.g. filtration and preservation. Example: BACT_NUC_W0.22-1.6.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: Environmental Package
FIELD.NAME: Environmental Package
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: Project Name
FIELD.NAME: Project Name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized. Example: Micro B3

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.43) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: finishing strategy
FIELD.NAME: finishing strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryote, bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Sampling

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Campaign
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Campaign
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to a finite or indefinite activity aiming at collecting data/samples, e.g. a cruise, a time series, a mesocosm experiment. Example: TARA_20110401Z.

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Site
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the site/station where data/sample collection is performed. Term list: OSD Site Registry or SDN:C17, http://tinyurl.com/oxux985 Example: Poseidon-E1-M3A Time Series Station.

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Platform
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Platform
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the unique stage from which the sampling device has been deployed. Includes Platform category from SDN:L06, http://seadatanet.maris2.nl/v_bodc_vocab_v2/search.asp?lib=L06, and Platform name. Example: Research Vessel Tara.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: biomass
FIELD.NAME: biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

FIELD.LABEL: density
FIELD.NAME: density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: density of sample

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Environment

FIELD.LABEL: Marine Region
FIELD.NAME: Marine Region
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the marine region name chosen from the Marine Regions vocabulary at http://www.marineregions.org/. Example: Aegean Sea.

FIELD.LABEL: Temperature
FIELD.NAME: Temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Temperature of water at the time of taking the sample. Format: ##.####, SDN:P02:75:TEMP, SDN:P06:46:UPAA for C. Example: 17.7122.

FIELD.LABEL: Salinity
FIELD.NAME: Salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Salinity of water at the time of taking the sample. Format: ##.#, SDN:P02::PSAL, SDN:P06::UGKG for PSU. Example: 39.1 psu.

FIELD.LABEL: Environment (Biome)
FIELD.NAME: Environment (Biome)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: Environment (Feature)
FIELD.NAME: Environment (Feature)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: Environment (Material)
FIELD.NAME: Environment (Material)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: specific host
FIELD.NAME: specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

FIELD.LABEL: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v 2013-10-28) terms, for a browser please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: alkalinity
FIELD.NAME: alkalinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

FIELD.LABEL: atmospheric data
FIELD.NAME: atmospheric data
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

FIELD.LABEL: conductivity
FIELD.NAME: conductivity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: electrical conductivity of water

FIELD.LABEL: water current
FIELD.NAME: water current
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid

FIELD.LABEL: fluorescence
FIELD.NAME: fluorescence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: raw (volts) or converted (mg Chla/m^3) fluorescence of the water

FIELD.LABEL: light intensity
FIELD.NAME: light intensity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of light intensity

FIELD.LABEL: mean friction velocity
FIELD.NAME: mean friction velocity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of mean friction velocity

FIELD.LABEL: mean peak friction velocity
FIELD.NAME: mean peak friction velocity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

FIELD.LABEL: downward PAR
FIELD.NAME: downward PAR
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column

FIELD.LABEL: photon flux
FIELD.NAME: photon flux
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of photon flux

FIELD.LABEL: pressure
FIELD.NAME: pressure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

FIELD.LABEL: tidal stage
FIELD.NAME: tidal stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: stage of tide

FIELD.LABEL: total depth of water column
FIELD.NAME: total depth of water column
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of total depth of water column

FIELD.LABEL: turbidity
FIELD.NAME: turbidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: turbidity measurement

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: alkyl diethers
FIELD.NAME: alkyl diethers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of alkyl diethers

FIELD.LABEL: aminopeptidase activity
FIELD.NAME: aminopeptidase activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

FIELD.LABEL: ammonium
FIELD.NAME: ammonium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of ammonium

FIELD.LABEL: bacterial carbon production
FIELD.NAME: bacterial carbon production
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of bacterial carbon production

FIELD.LABEL: bacterial production
FIELD.NAME: bacterial production
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake

FIELD.LABEL: bacterial respiration
FIELD.NAME: bacterial respiration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column

FIELD.LABEL: bishomohopanol
FIELD.NAME: bishomohopanol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of bishomohopanol

FIELD.LABEL: bromide
FIELD.NAME: bromide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of bromide

FIELD.LABEL: calcium
FIELD.NAME: calcium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of calcium

FIELD.LABEL: carbon/nitrogen ratio
FIELD.NAME: carbon/nitrogen ratio
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: chloride
FIELD.NAME: chloride
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chloride

FIELD.LABEL: chlorophyll
FIELD.NAME: chlorophyll
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chlorophyll

FIELD.LABEL: diether lipids
FIELD.NAME: diether lipids
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.NAME: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.NAME: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved inorganic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved inorganic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved inorganic phosphorus
FIELD.NAME: dissolved inorganic phosphorus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: dissolved organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved oxygen

FIELD.LABEL: glucosidase activity
FIELD.NAME: glucosidase activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of glucosidase activity

FIELD.LABEL: magnesium
FIELD.NAME: magnesium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of magnesium

FIELD.LABEL: n-alkanes
FIELD.NAME: n-alkanes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

FIELD.LABEL: nitrate
FIELD.NAME: nitrate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrate

FIELD.LABEL: nitrite
FIELD.NAME: nitrite
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrite

FIELD.LABEL: nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrogen (total)

FIELD.LABEL: organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: organic matter
FIELD.NAME: organic matter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic matter

FIELD.LABEL: organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: particulate organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: particulate organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of particulate organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: particulate organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: particulate organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of particulate organic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: petroleum hydrocarbon
FIELD.NAME: petroleum hydrocarbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

FIELD.LABEL: phaeopigments
FIELD.NAME: phaeopigments
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

FIELD.LABEL: phosphate
FIELD.NAME: phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.NAME: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

FIELD.LABEL: potassium
FIELD.NAME: potassium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of potassium

FIELD.LABEL: primary production
FIELD.NAME: primary production
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of primary production

FIELD.LABEL: redox potential
FIELD.NAME: redox potential
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

FIELD.LABEL: silicate
FIELD.NAME: silicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of silicate

FIELD.LABEL: sodium
FIELD.NAME: sodium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sodium concentration

FIELD.LABEL: soluble reactive phosphorus
FIELD.NAME: soluble reactive phosphorus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus

FIELD.LABEL: sulfate
FIELD.NAME: sulfate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfate

FIELD.LABEL: sulfide
FIELD.NAME: sulfide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfide

FIELD.LABEL: suspended particulate matter
FIELD.NAME: suspended particulate matter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of suspended particulate matter

FIELD.LABEL: total dissolved nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total dissolved nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: total inorganic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total inorganic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total inorganic nitrogen content

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total nitrogen content of the sample

FIELD.LABEL: total particulate carbon
FIELD.NAME: total particulate carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total particulate carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: total phosphorus
FIELD.NAME: total phosphorus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD.LABEL: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.NAME: miscellaneous parameter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS sediment
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS sediment
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: geography

FIELD.LABEL: environmental package
FIELD.NAME: environmental package
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: environment (biome)
FIELD.NAME: environment (biome)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (feature)
FIELD.NAME: environment (feature)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: environment (material)
FIELD.NAME: environment (material)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (altitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (altitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (elevation)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (elevation)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: investigation type
FIELD.NAME: investigation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIxS compliant reports as standardised by Genomic Standards Consortium

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.43) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: finishing strategy
FIELD.NAME: finishing strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryote, bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check
FIELD.NAME: chimera check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

FIELD.LABEL: biomass
FIELD.NAME: biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

FIELD.LABEL: density
FIELD.NAME: density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: density of sample

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: specific host
FIELD.NAME: specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

FIELD.LABEL: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v 2013-10-28) terms, for a browser please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD.LABEL: potassium
FIELD.NAME: potassium

FIELD.LABEL: redox potential
FIELD.NAME: redox potential

FIELD.LABEL: salinity

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: sulfate

FIELD.LABEL: sulfide

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen
